classes package

Submodules

classes.Component module

class classes.Component.Component(name, component_key, partition_group)[source]

Bases: object

Component class, contains components parsed from candidate_deployments.yaml

Parameters:

  • self.name (str) – name of the component (e.g. blurry-faces, blurry-faces-onnx_partition1_1, …)

  • self.component_key (str) – (e.g. component1, component1_partitionX_1, …)

  • self.containers ([Container]) – list of the Containers of the component

  • self.next (str) – if the component is partitioned, and there is a following partition, this will contain the name of the next component, otherwise is None

  • self.parallelism ([int]) – parallelism array as copied from run_parameters.yaml

  • self.time_distribution (str) – time distribution (deterministic or exponential), copied from run_parameters.yaml

  • self.partition_group (int) – the first value in the partition id, e.g. the X in X_1

  • self.partition_number (int) – inside a group, identify the position of the partition (first, second, …)

_get_correct_image(docker_image)[source]

Selects the correct image for a given container, if there are multiple available

Parameters:

docker_image – this could be a str or a list of str

Returns:

the correct image

_update_name(partition_group)[source]

Transforms the name of a partitioned component from the general version (e.g. X_1), to a specific one (e.g. 1_1)

Returns:

None

add_container(parent, unit_id, computing_units, memory_size, docker_image, gpu_requirement)[source]

Adds a Container to the component, see class Container for more details

Returns:

None

is_partition()[source]
Returns:

True if the component is partitioned, False otherwise

set_following_partition(components)[source]

This function looks for components that have the same partition group and partition number + 1; if found, “self.next” is set to the name of that component

Parameters:

components – list of Components, only those in the same group of the one being called (e.g. only the one that fall under component1 and its partitions)

Returns:

None

set_parallelism(parallelism)[source]

Sets the parallelism of the component to the value received

Returns:

None

set_time_distribution(time_distribution)[source]

Sets the time distribution of the component to the value received

Returns:

None

class classes.Component.Container(parent, unit, image, computing_units, memory_size, gpu_requirement, is_partition, partition_group)[source]

Bases: object

Container class, contains containers parsed from candidate_deployments.yaml

Parameters:

  • self.parent (str) – parent Component, actual class not just the name

  • self.unit (str) – unit id of the container, e.g. C1@VM2, C1P1.1@VM2, …

  • self.image (str) – URL of the image of the container

  • self.computing_units (float) – number of computing units required by the container

  • self.memory_size (int) – memory size of the container, in MB

  • self.gpu_requirement (bool) – True if the container requires a GPU, False otherwise

_update_id(partition_group)[source]

Transforms the unit ID of the container from the general version (e.g. X_1), to a specific one (e.g. 1_1)

Returns:

None

classes.Component.generalize_name(component_name)[source]

Receives a specific component_name, and returns a generalized one (e.g. blurry-faces-onnx_partitionX_1 -> blurry-faces-onnx_partition1_1)

Return str:

generalized component name

classes.Component.generalize_unit_id(unit_id)[source]

Receives a specific unit ID and returns a generalized one (e.g. C1P1.1@VM1 -> C1PX.1@VM1)

Return str:

generalized unit ID

classes.Component.get_alternative_containers(unit)[source]

Returns the list of alternative CONTAINERS keys of a base component, if the resource matches

Return [str]:

list of alternative containers keys

classes.Resource module

class classes.Resource.Resource(name, resource_type, physical_nodes, execution_layer)[source]

Bases: object

Resource class, contains resources parsed from candidate_resources.yaml

Parameters:

  • self.name (str) – name of the resource (e.g. VM1, RasPi, …)

  • self.type (str) – type of resource, physical, virtual or lambda

  • self.oscarcli_alias (str) – oscarcli alias of the resource (e.g. oscar-VM1)

  • self.storage_provider (str) – storage provider of the resource, usually minio, s3 for lambdas

  • self.storage_provider_alias (str) – storage provider alias (e.g. minio-VM1), always “aws” for lambdas

  • self.ssh (str) – ssh address of the resource, if physical, saved as user@host:port

  • self.total_nodes (int) – max number of nodes of the resource

  • self.max_cpu_cores (float) – max number of cpu cores of the resource (node resource times the number of nodes)

  • self.max_memory_mb (int) – max memory size in MB of the resource (node resource times the number of nodes)

  • self.bucket_name (str) – name of the s3 bucket of the resource (if lambda, None otherwise)

  • self.execution_layer (int) – execution layer of the resource

_set_ssh(physical_nodes)[source]

Sets the ssh address of the resource from the physical_nodes.yaml file if the resource is physical, otherwise sets it to None.

Returns:

None

_set_type(resource_type)[source]

Sets the type of the resource as physical, virtual or lambda

Returns:

None

is_lambda()[source]
Returns:

True if the resource is on a lambda, False otherwise

is_physical()[source]
Returns:

True if the resource is physical, False otherwise

set_storage_provider_alias(storage_provider)[source]

Sets the storage provider alias of the resource

Parameters:

storage_provider (str) – either minio or s3

Returns:

None

classes.Service module

class classes.Service.Service(unit, name, input_bucket_index)[source]

Bases: object

Service class, a service is the object that is actually deployed, this class contains the necessary information

Parameters:

  • self.unit (str) – unit id of the service (e.g. C1@VM2, C1P1.1@VM2, …)

  • self.name (str) – name of the service (e.g. blurry-faces, …)

  • self.resource (str) – resource of the service (e.g. VM1, RasPi, …)

  • self.image (str) – URL of the docker image of the service

  • self.input_bucket_index (int) – index of the input bucket, numbered in increasing order (e.g. 0 for the first service, 1 for the second…)

  • self.input_bucket (str) – name of the input bucket, numbered in increasing order (e.g. bucket0 for the first service, bucket1 for the second…)

  • self.output_bucket (str) – name of the output bucket

  • self.storage_provider_alias (str) – storage provider alias, the dash is replaced with a dot (e.g. minio-VM1 -> minio.VM1) so that it be written in the correct format to the FDL file

  • self.oscarcli_alias (str) – oscarcli alias of the service, as copied by the correct resource

  • self.cpu (float) – number of cpu cores required by the service

  • self.memory (int) – memory size in MB required by the service

  • self.is_lambda (bool) – True if the service is a lambda, False otherwise

  • self.parallelism ([int]) – parallelism array as copied by the parent component

set_buckets_full_workflow()[source]

Sets the input and output buckets for the test in the full workflow, so the output buckets needs to match the input bucket of the next service

Returns:

None

set_buckets_single_testing()[source]

Sets the input and output buckets for the test in the single testing, the index is the same, the input bucket is named “temp” and the output bucket is named “trash”

Returns:

None
